subject: Add new google ipmi sys command: SysHostPowerOff
commitMessage:
Add new google ipmi sys command: SysHostPowerOff

New google ipmi sys command to let the BMC knows host shutdown,
allow host to gracefully shutdown and disable the watchdog with given
time delay.

Signed-off-by: Yunyun Lin <linyuny@google.com>
Change-Id: I02171c9cfed57ae5d10d66b515e4ab7ee8856466

Patch Set 10: Commit message was updated.
Change has been successfully merged by Yunyun Lin
make this one line and put the more details in the lines after it.
Do we need to close the ofs file in case it cannot be open or created ?
The file failed to open just because it doesn't exist. I don't think we need close it.

oFF -> off or OFF?

also print the error message. I think it is e.what().

Updated. 
But for error message. I don't think it is necessary to specify it.
This is the micro definition. Func hostS5PowerOffDelay utilize the same type of passing parameter and return value like psuResetDelay did(in line #28).
Can we call this HostPowerOff here and everywhere. I don't think S5 is helpful information and somewhat confusing with other uses of S5.
This filename should be named based on the above `host_poweroff_delay` or similar
You should move this after close, in case that operation fails (which can happen with data wrties)
no need to flush, closing does this inherently

Sys -> System

move `host S5 mode` to something else.

Some grammar issue. Maybe should be?
```
It needs to disable the fallback watchdog with given time delay...
```

Not sure if we want to use the new Mock Macro like in https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-ipmi-blobs/+/42611?

Or just make is consistent.

Maybe I'll make a new change to update it later.
Let's keep it consistency and move it to new macro in new patch.
I don't think we should be posting internal links here...
